title: BADecker
author: BADecker
content: Here is a piece of bottom-line info about the news and what's going on in the world.We Don't Really Know What's Happening http://www.freedomsphoenix.com/Article/351720-2023-10-05-we-dont-really-know-whats-happening.htmAnd, believe it or not, this is rather good news. I'll explain.We all like to know what's happening in the world, and for good reason… understanding our surroundings is essential to survival. We instinctively seek information… we need information. There is, however, a problem that we face:No matter how much "news" you consume, you won't really know what's going on in the world.We can't know, because 'the news' is half illusion, provided by government-dependent corporations that are paid to keep you watching and to keep you joined to the status quo.Granted, they are quite good at providing pictures from disaster areas, but when it comes to explaining why the disaster happened, they mislead almost every time. Yes, some truth makes its way through the news machine, but most of it is wrapped in layers of manipulation. If, for example, you watch the news feeds all day, you'll find a good deal of truth, but you'll find it amongst a pile of half-truths. Do you really have enough time to analyze them all?One Piece of TruthThe truth about public reporting comes out from time to time, but usually well after the fact. So, here's one piece of truth that's worth remembering:...

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: We never knew what was actually happening on the world, thrus we learn something new everyday. Due to this planet being so big and being too much information out there.Both right and left wing media have then own personal interests which seek to push forward by filtering the news which help to achieve that mission. We are busy in our lives and we have to either decide to trust people may not be trustworthy or simply disconnect ourselves from reality and only take care of information which does not have to do with geopolitics, macroeconomics, or international developments. It is very concerning, but news are not what they used to be anymore, they are more about the hosts conjectures than the actual facts.

comments.author: Gozie51
comments.body: Some times some people refer government as a confraternity that you never know the truth about what is happening there but to be left guessing of the true position of things after their state house reporters have gauged out what they were told by a higher level information reportage from the personal assistance(s).The people only know what they want them to know either for some basic reasons like security and welfare of the country. As imagined, the reasons for keeping out some secrets from the public is for the continuity of government and governance, national stability and perceived peace. We actually can not know what is happening because the truth is far from us.

As imagined, the reasons for keeping out some secrets from the public is for the continuity of government and governance, national stability and perceived peace. We actually can not know what is happening because the truth is far from us.Sometimes, the lack of information about government affairs could be as selfish as just some politicians not wanting the general public to realize about the serious inefficiencies within certain administrations. It is something it is very common to see in countries like mine, opacity for the sake of keeping a facade, does not even enhance national security to keep such information away from all of us. If you have studied a bit about Authoritarian regimes, you would know what I mean

comments.body: We’re just normal, regular people. We’e never going to be in the know & kept up to date with real world event decisions & policies. Governments, the powers that be will always make big decisions that we don’t know about, trade agreements etc. We just have to get on with our lives & hope that their decisions don't screw with our lives too much.

Where does the strength lie? Bible - 1 Corinthians 1:26-31:Quote from: https://biblehub.com/niv/1_corinthians/1.htm26Brothers and sisters, think of what you were when you were called. Not many of you were wise by human standards; not many were influential; not many were of noble birth. 27But God chose the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God chose the weak things of the world to shame the strong. 28God chose the lowly things of this world and the despised things—and the things that are not—to nullify the things that are, 29so that no one may boast before him. 30It is because of him that you are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God—that is, our righteousness, holiness and redemption. 31Therefore, as it is written: “Let the one who boasts boast in the Lord.”Think of the trouble that is in the world. We live in peace for a while, and then we are gone. And after a few years even the memory of us is gone. It's like this for everybody, rich and poor, good and evil, Pelosi and the FBI, and all of us little people, as well.But if we are found to be believers in God and Jesus-salvation, we will live again, in the strength of God, forever.
